item.title: Timers that increase over a period of time
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

TeleNubby = Me
Waffles = Food-Guy

Since we got that straight, lol… Hm…

Try changing

if(treespawn > 0)
   		treespawn += 1;
		if(treespawn < 0)
    		treespawn = 0;

To…

                if(treespawn < 2147483647)
   		treespawn += 1;

And then change the other longer part of the code you posted to:

case 1278:
if(playerHasItem(1351) || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1351) {
startAnimation(879);
addItem(1511, 1);
addSkillXP(1000, 8);
sendMessage("You get some logs.");
if(xtrue == false) {
treespawn = 0; xtrue = true;
} } else {
sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!");
}
if (treespawn == 100) {
ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1342, 0, 10);
xtrue = false;
}
if (treespawn == 200) {
ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1278, 0, 10);
xtrue = false;
}
break;

And then under

public class Client extrends Player implements Runnable {

Put

public boolean xtrue = false;

Hope I helped. I kinda zipped through it and just changed a few things. If you have any questions or problems, just ask.

Read full topic
item.source: Timers that increase over a period of time

item.title: Timers that increase over a period of time
item.dc:creator: @Sdrawkcab Sdrawkcab
item.description:
@Sdrawkcab wrote:

I saw a post like this earlier, and figured I’d get in on it, since I didn’t have the time earlier.

If you have

if(treespawn > 0) treespawn += 1; if(treespawn < 0) treespawn = 0;
Declared in process, and this case(credits to that kid, with a name something like food…)

case 1278: if(playerHasItem(1351) || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1351) { startAnimation(879); addItem(1511, 1); addSkillXP(1000, 8); sendMessage("You get some logs."); treetimer ++; treespawn ++; } else { treetimer --; sendMessage("You need an axe to cut this tree!"); } if (treetimer == 1) { ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1342, 0, 10); treetimer = 0; } if (treespawn == 10) { ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1278, 0, 10); } break;

How come the treespawn timer won’t go up? Telenubby(I think) said that it should work, as process is called every 500ms.

Thanks if you can help, I’m sure that food-named guy will appreciate the help!

Read full topic
item.source: Timers that increase over a period of time
